      • setIndentationToSpaces

        public void setIndentationToSpaces(int amountOfSpaces)
        Sets the output indentation to the desired amount of spaces
        Parameters:
        amountOfSpaces - amount of spaces

      • describe

        public void describe(java.lang.String nodeDescription,
                     java.lang.Runnable nodeCode)
        Creates a new node (branch) in the testing code with a description of it

        GreenTeaLatte deliciousLatte = new GreenTeaLatte(); deliciousLatte.describe("className", () -> { deliciousLatte.describe("methodName", () -> { // define tests and hooks for testing methodName }); });

        Parameters:
        nodeDescription - description of the new node
        nodeCode - code for the tests in the current node

      • it

        public void it(java.lang.String testDescription)
        Creates and attaches a pending test to the current node

        A pending test is a test that does not have the test code written yet. Pending tests will result in a warning, but not an error.

        This is meant to be called with the runnable of a describe method, but can be be called on the root node.

        Parameters:
        testDescription - description of the pending test

      • it

        public void it(java.lang.String testDescription,
               java.lang.Runnable testCode)
        Creates and attaches a test to the current node

        This is meant to be called with the runnable of a describe method, but can be be called on the root node.

        Not including a "assertTest" call within a test will act as a pending test and result in a warning.

        Parameters:
        testDescription - description of the test
        testCode - code for the test

      • assertTest

        public void assertTest(java.lang.Boolean resultFromTestExpression)
        Evaluates the result from a test expression

        This must be called within a test (inside a runnable passed to the `it` method) used to determine if a test failed or passed

        Parameters:
        resultFromTestExpression - boolean from a user defined test expression

      • before

        public void before(java.lang.String description,
                   java.lang.Runnable setup)
        Define a block of code to run before the current node executes any tests

        This only runs once for the "describe" node that it is defined in. Multiple before code blocks can be defined. When there are multiple blocks defined, they will execute in the order that they are defined.

        Parameters:
        description - description for the setup
        setup - code for the setup

      • after

        public void after(java.lang.String description,
                  java.lang.Runnable cleanup)
        Define a block of code to run after the current node executes any tests

        This only runs once for the "describe" node that it is defined in. Multiple after code blocks can be defined. When there are multiple blocks defined, they will execute in the order that they are defined.

        Parameters:
        description - description for the cleanup
        cleanup - code for the cleanup

      • beforeEach

        public void beforeEach(java.lang.String description,
                       java.lang.Runnable setup)
        Define a block of code to run before each test

        This only runs once for each "it" test in the current node. Multiple before code blocks can be defined. When there are multiple blocks defined, they will execute in the order that they are defined.

        Parameters:
        description - description for the setup
        setup - code for the setup

      • afterEach

        public void afterEach(java.lang.String description,
                      java.lang.Runnable cleanup)
        Define a block of code to run after each test

        This only runs once for each "it" test in the current node. Multiple before code blocks can be defined. When there are multiple blocks defined, they will execute in the order that they are defined.

        Parameters:
        description - description for the cleanup
        cleanup - code for the cleanup

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs all tests that have been defined

        Runs deepest level tests first.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - any error that occured to stop tests from running or throws a RuntimeException after all tests have been run if one of them failed

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Create a human readable string of current node
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        description with indentation
